CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( Kraftfahrgesetz ) , as amended in DATE , provides as follows :

The ultimate sentence of this provision was enacted as a provision of constitutional rank after ORG had , in its judgments of DATE and CARDINAL DATE , quashed previous similar provisions on the ground that they were contrary to LAW which prohibits inter alia that a suspect be obliged on pain of a fine to incriminate himself .

CARDINAL . In its judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG found that the first to third sentences of section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW as amended in DATE were , like the previous provisions , contrary to the right not to incriminate oneself which flowed from LAW and from LAW but were saved by the ultimate sentence of that provision which had constitutional rank . In reaching that conclusion ORG had examined whether the ultimate sentence of section CARDINAL § CARDINAL was contrary to the guiding principles of the LAW , but had found that this was not the case .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW , in the version in force at the material time , provided for a fine of up to ORG CARDINAL to be imposed on a person who violates the regulations of this Act .
CARDINAL . NORP The DATE amendment of ORG ( GPE ) introduced a possibility to issue and serve an anonymous order ( LOC ) in case of minor administrative criminal offences .
CARDINAL . According to section DATE of ORG , the competent authority may determine by decree minor offences for which it may serve an anonymous order .

CARDINAL . If the person who has committed a minor administrative criminal offence is unknown to the competent authorities , the latter may serve an anonymous order on the person who is supposed to know the offender . The fine imposed must not exceed ORG CARDINAL and may not be converted into a prison term in default .

CARDINAL . The anonymous order is not regarded as an act of prosecution . No remedy lies against it . If the fine imposed is not paid within DATE , the anonymous order automatically becomes invalid and a normal prosecution against unknown offenders is to be commenced . If the fine imposed is paid within DATE , no prosecution is to take place . The anonymous order is not entered into any register and may not be taken into account when determining the sentence for other administrative criminal offences .
